channel.title: Making a monster shoot a projectile?
channel.description: How would I make an npc shoot a projectile flying towards the player such as an arrow? I'm pretty sure roflscape had that but he took off the link :(

No I have to put that whole code to make createProjectiles appear

item.title: Making a monster shoot a projectile?
item.dc:creator: @delta delta
item.description:
@delta wrote:

The createProjectile method will only show if this happens:

int offsetX = (absY - EnemyY) * -1; int offsetY = (absX - EnemyX) * -1; for (int a = 0; a < handler.maxPlayers; a++) { client temp = (client) handler.players[a]; if ((temp != null) && (temp.absX > 0) && !temp.disconnected && (Math.abs(absX - temp.absX) < 60) && (Math.abs(absY - temp.absY) < 60)) { temp.createProjectile(absY, absX, offsetY, offsetX, 50, 90, arrowgfx, 43, 35, 0 - AttackingOn);
And I don’t think I can fit all of that in tztok-jad’s mage attack…

Read full topic

item.source: Making a monster shoot a projectile?

item.title: Making a monster shoot a projectile?
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

Method:

[code]
public void createProjectile(int casterY, int casterX, int offsetY, int offsetX, int angle, int speed, int gfxMoving, int startHeight, int endHeight, int lockon) {
for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players) {
if (p != null) {
client person = (client) p;

            if ((person.playerName != null || person.playerName != "null")) {
                if (person.distanceToPoint(casterX, casterY) <= 10) {
                    person.createProjectile3(casterY, casterX, offsetY,
                            offsetX, angle, speed, gfxMoving, startHeight,
                            endHeight, lockon);
                }
            }
        }
    }
}[/code]

Your gonna aim at the player, but don’t put a hitDiff, since you don’t want it to attack them, only show the arrow go over their head.

In Npchandler Class, EnemyY and EnemyX are already declared so put like:

EnemyY -2 , EnemyX - 2

2 Squares minus their X and Y.

Actually fix that, log on, and look at where the arrow is going to be shooting at, either in the X axis or Y axis, and have it aim behind that axis.

Read full topic
